roleset.name: move towards, movement towards something

example.name: more or less concrete
example.text: Jim Unruh, Unisys's president, said he is approaching next year with caution.

example.name: somewhat metaphorical, 'coming to'
example.text: After coming close to a partial settlement a year ago, shareholders who filed civil suits against Ivan F. Boesky and the partnerships he once controlled again are approaching an accord, people familiar with the case said.
example.arg: After coming close to a partial settlement a year ago
shareholders who filed civil suits against Ivan F. Boesky and the partnerships he once controlled

example.name: passive, with a proposition
example.text: Earlier, American Medical said [it]-1 had been approached *trace*-1 again by two other possible suitors, whom it wouldn't identify but who had previously submitted bids for the company.
example.arg: by two other possible suitors, whom it wouldn't identify but who had previously submitted bids for the company

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The aircraft's approach to the White House was illegally close.

example.name: Arg 1 as "of" PP
example.text: With the approach of spring, Mary began looking through seed catalogs.

example.name: Arg 2 and DIR
example.text: The climbers started on the south approach to the summit.

example.name: metaphorical approach
example.text: In his final novel he makes his closest approach to greatness.

roleset.note:
APPROACH-V NOTES: Member of Vncls escape-51.1-1 and escape-51-1-1-2. (from approach.01-v)
APPROACH-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb approach.01, OntoNotes grouping approach-n senses 1, 4, 5, 6 and 8; maps to VN class escape-51.1-2. Framed by Claire. (from approach.01-n)

roleset.name: treat, deal with

example.name: all args
example.text: ``We've approached this as a fundamental change the industry is going through,'' Mr. Unruh said.
example.arg: as a fundamental change the industry is going through

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: His approach to every problem is to draw up a list of pros and cons.

example.name: Arg 1 & MNR
example.text: This book takes a unique approach to the era of European colonialism.
example.arg: to the era of European colonialism.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: This approach to teaching as a distributed teaching/learning process is...

roleset.note:
APPROACH-V NOTES: Member of Vncls confront-98. (from approach.02-v)
APPROACH-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry approach.02, OntoNotes grouping approach-n sense 3; maps to VN class confront-98. Framed by Claire. (from approach.02-n)

roleset.name: easy to approach

role.descr: entity that is easy to approach

example.name: arg1
example.text: I think he simply wanted to tell the world that this president is approachable and it is a type of performance art that he employed to demonstrate his common touch .

roleset.note: APPROACHABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6. Relates to both approach.01 and approach.02. (from approachable.01-j)
